definitions.definition: a part of something that is separate from the other parts or can be considered separately

examples.text: She cleaned a small segment of the painting.
Lines divided the area into segments.
The changes will affect only a small segment of the population.
They divided the bone into equal segments.

definitions.definition: one of the sections of an orange, a lemon, etc.
a part of a circle separated from the rest by a single line
the smallest speech sound that a word can be divided into

wordOrigin: late 16th cent. (as a term in geometry): from Latin segmentum, from secare ‘to cut’. The verb dates from the mid 19th cent.
